data.text:
Sustainable gastronomy helps improve:

🥦 Food security & nutrition
👩‍🌾 Sustainable food production
🌱 Conservation of biodiversity

More on Saturday's  #SustainableGastronomyDay. https://t.co/ihTHw6ZkWM #GlobalGoals https://t.co/9cqUTTZUyS

"Renewables not only fight the climate crisis, they support energy security."

@antonioguterres stresses that renewable energy sources are already cheaper than fossil fuels and create three times more jobs. https://t.co/kUttqhlAaz https://t.co/hqVj41D3oD

We all depend on soil for our food, but every 5 seconds the equivalent of one soccer field is lost due to soil erosion, which is a major threat to food security & achievement of the #GlobalGoals.

More on Friday's #DesertificationAndDroughtDay: https://t.co/nvf1WOWp4Q via @FAO https://t.co/TTMJBdV7k5

#COVID19 has demonstrated the fragility of our world - and the importance of protecting the environment, human health & economies.

On Friday’s #DesertificationAndDroughtDay, learn how sustainable land-based solutions can increase resilience: https://t.co/QCw2lSqSMX https://t.co/lOybD0oyBB

New campaign aims to prevent a massive oil spill from a decaying tanker stranded off the coast of Yemen.

The #FSOSafer is at risk of exploding or leaking at any time, which could result in disastrous environmental & humanitarian consequences. https://t.co/OI75EBsv3x

Africa's Great Green Wall project aims to restore 100 million hectares of degraded lands in the Sahel by 2030.

On Friday’s #DesertificationAndDroughtDay, see how @FAO supports this project to address climate change, desertification & food insecurity: https://t.co/sIpqQ0U1Oq https://t.co/KiwPYUNjhj

Catastrophic socio-economic meltdown has left Lebanon hanging on by a thread, warns top UN official in the country.

Emergency Response Plan extended through the end of the year, but an additional $163 million is needed to meet dire humanitarian needs. https://t.co/xs73MX8sVl

Drought is one of the most severe natural disasters. By 2050, it may affect about 3/4 of the world's population. 

On Friday’s #DesertificationAndDroughtDay, @UNCCD explains how you can take action: https://t.co/3PBbZzOIs4 https://t.co/bUoMVKA7PH

“Let me be clear: what we are witnessing today in Afghanistan is the institutionalized, systematic oppression of women.” 

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet tells the Human Rights Council that the rights of women & girls in Afghanistan must be upheld. https://t.co/8WuvXp6Y1t

Millions of domestic workers lack access to social protection. 

On Thursday's #DomesticWorkersDay, let’s support their right to medical care, maternity & unemployment protection, family & sickness benefits and much more.

https://t.co/a2VSZkhBxp via @ILO https://t.co/To1E3QXrF7

Thursday's International Day of #FamilyRemittances highlights the financial contribution of 200 million migrant workers around the world to their families & communities back home.

More from @IFAD: https://t.co/qjaIKZSq1P https://t.co/y1RROfmKhA

1 in every 78 people on earth has been #ForcedToFlee. 

We must act now to find solutions for this growing human tragedy.

Latest Global Trends report from @Refugees: https://t.co/gnHlXABMGs #WithRefugees https://t.co/k22p0YQjKQ

Record upsurge of desert locusts in East Africa & Yemen has come to an end. 

Learn about @FAO's efforts over the last 3 years to protect people & their well-being from this destructive pest. https://t.co/LD1wOLZkqO https://t.co/dDNiqM9oco

The majority of migrants work legally, contributing to both their home & host countries, and helping achieve the #GlobalGoals.

More on Thursday's International Day of #FamilyRemittances: https://t.co/YbCt9YwLJ3 https://t.co/MUfPJlOtlr

"Gender equality offers a path to sustainable peace & conflict prevention, and yet we are moving in the opposite direction."

-- @antonioguterres says greater inclusion of women & girls is needed for a more peaceful world. https://t.co/SqOyzyRkDI

"Had we invested massively in renewable energy in the past, we would not be so dramatically at the mercy of the instability of fossil fuel markets."

-- @antonioguterres says our energy mix is broken & renewables are the peace plan of the 21st century. https://t.co/DnZNVIcye0 https://t.co/tHPvTzIAQJ

Ukraine: @UNHumanRights is investigating reports of children being forcibly deported from eastern part of country.

@mbachelet expresses concern that removal efforts do not include steps for family reunification or respect the best interests of the child. https://t.co/2dimWzTjGp

The war in Ukraine is creating a collateral wave of food insecurity, which is fueling a global hunger crisis.

@WFP explains where the impact is being felt the most: https://t.co/MZ8gbNMhzM https://t.co/Kb9ZBmUiNJ

If average global temperatures increased by 2°C, coral reefs would almost completely disappear, which would be catastrophic for people & planet.

We must #ActNow. 

Get ideas on how you can take #ClimateAction to protect our future: https://t.co/dDZ0DeYPhW https://t.co/BnxT6fPYge

Wednesday is World Elder Abuse Awareness Day. 

Elder abuse is preventable. Everyone has a role to play -- by watching for signs, staying connected, getting help from local services & more. https://t.co/NdwFdYPdED https://t.co/zzBAijIHkC

Monkeypox: @WHO to convene emergency committee to determine if spread of virus represents a Public Health Emergency of International Concern.

"The global outbreak of monkeypox is clearly unusual and concerning," says @DrTedros. https://t.co/Mz6EGGanOv

Elder abuse can lead to serious distress & harm, including physical injuries & long-term psychological consequences.

More on Wednesday's World Elder Abuse Awareness Day: https://t.co/NdwFdYPdED https://t.co/JNwCqFhruf

"Together, we have the tools to tackle the root causes of systemic marginalization of persons with disabilities in every corner of the world."

--@antonioguterres stresses the importance of ensuring all people can fully participate in every aspect of life. https://t.co/gK2mIYgvNQ https://t.co/e0n6qGnNB7

"I respect the strength & resolve of Myanmar’s people, who continue to reject & resist the military & their attempts to assert control."

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet says the people of Myanmar deserve a return to democracy & an end to impunity. https://t.co/bVqaSQmB4U

South Sudan: A lack of funding has forced @WFP to suspend food assistance to millions of people.

The suspension of aid comes at the worst possible time as the country faces a year of unprecedented hunger. https://t.co/tisqxyMzSG

The only true path to energy security, stable power prices, prosperity & a livable planet lies in abandoning fossil fuels & accelerating the renewables-based energy transition.

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/hBoN05y0k2 https://t.co/x02Y4Cv3Zp

Happy birthday to UN Messenger of Peace @lang_lang!

Thank you for your tireless commitment to improving the lives of children around the world through education and music. https://t.co/Eaa9piTYi4 https://t.co/bVe0l03X0e

Babies are #NotATarget. 

Children are #NotATarget. 

Civilians are #NotATarget. 

Hospitals are #NotATarget.

Health care workers are #NotATarget. 

Schools are #NotATarget. 

Humanitarians are #NotATarget. https://t.co/DOFkZSwRAg

🩸 Every few seconds, someone, somewhere, needs safe blood.

Tuesday's World Blood Donor Day is an opportunity to learn from @WHO about how donating blood can help save lives. https://t.co/lO509m5bg3 https://t.co/snMV25LRo7

Afghanistan: Almost half of the country's population is facing acute hunger.

To help combat the crisis, @FAO & @WorldBank are providing $195 million in emergency aid to deliver life-saving support to the most vulnerable, including women & girls. https://t.co/8JjLijTpUT

Urgent support is needed to prevent a major oil spill by the #FSOSafer, stranded off the coast of Yemen.

Any spill would destroy ocean ecosystems, and result in the loss of 200,000 fishing jobs & the close of crucial shipping ports.

How you can help: https://t.co/K8UjoOU2Ex https://t.co/3ptWsiPK15

Every year on 21 September, the UN calls on all people to lay down weapons & reaffirm their commitment to living in harmony. 

As we mark the 100-day countdown to #PeaceDay, this aspiration is more pressing than ever.

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/tWMx2SXXAr https://t.co/YqZCTMvYo7

"I urge us to marshal a greater sense of collective responsibility and ambition that puts people, their protection, and their rights first."

-- @mbachelet tells Human Rights Council in her last session as @UNHumanRights chief. https://t.co/MTt4LW6sVs

"Everything we hold dear relies on us protecting our oceans."

-- @UNEP Patron of the Oceans & pioneer swimmer @LewisPugh was in NYC last week for #WorldOceansDay, where he called for urgent #ClimateAction to #SaveOurOcean. https://t.co/QtPJbVXpcf https://t.co/d3rr7x2Odm

Monday begins the 100-day countdown to #PeaceDay, which this year, will focus on ending racism & building peace. 

We all have a role to play in fostering peace -- and tackling racism is a crucial way to contribute. https://t.co/OnNmU2jvvX #FightRacism https://t.co/iuY7nFnlbk

People with albinism have a long way to go to achieve equality & recognition. 

They must be included in important discussions on human rights to protect them from discrimination.

Monday is #AlbinismDay. https://t.co/7MKNJl1zls https://t.co/irr1HvH1Sh

The difference between 1.5°C and 2°C of global warming can seem marginal. 

But they represent vastly different scenarios for our future. 

Every fraction of a degree matters. 
#ActNow: https://t.co/CDodr7661k via @UNFCCC https://t.co/hN4dveiY5Z

Ethiopia: Women and girls are being disproportionately affected by the consequences of the worst drought in 40 years.

With many schools closed, girls are especially vulnerable to abuse & exploitation.

See how @UNFPA is helping address this crisis. https://t.co/kSxrXKfuiQ

Every day, people with albinism suffer serious human rights violations -- and this situation has worsened amid #COVID19. 

Yet, they continue to defy odds, overcome hurdles & face injustices with resilience.

More on Monday's #AlbinismDay: https://t.co/7MKNJljad0 https://t.co/sVCYYZ8qAX

We all have a role to play in stopping the spread of harmful misinformation online, which can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable during a crisis.

#PledgetoPause and verify facts by asking basic questions before you share.
https://t.co/qFqoh7CZOA https://t.co/1jE0LbjoUc

Many indigenous languages are on the verge of never being spoken or heard again.

Protecting them means preserving the cultural & intellectual heritage they represent.

Get involved during the International Decade of Indigenous Languages. https://t.co/fOLrbJAP2e #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/E69qAYUPZo

"People want to breathe clean air, drink clean water. They want to be able to live & practice their traditional crafts in the same places where their ancestors did."

-- @VladislavKaim of @YAGClimate calls for #ClimateAction on our Awake At Night podcast. https://t.co/b36VgInyFG https://t.co/26xKEn6hb6

More than 1 in 10 children around the world carry out work that damages their well-being & prevents them from fulfilling their dreams.

On Sunday's #NoChildLabour Day, see what @ilo is doing to prevent this harmful practice: https://t.co/lfYwS1gJGB https://t.co/RlKTwnNkF0

🚉 Using public transport
🚯 Reducing food waste
👚 Buying sustainable fashion

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis! 

Chat with us over our new @WhatsApp messaging service & find out how you can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/1e9CNwMRlX https://t.co/6ZAW5rmwVR

Urgent action is needed to ensure no child is forced into child labour.

On Sunday's #NoChildLabour Day, @ilo is calling for increased investment in social protection systems to protect children from exploitation. https://t.co/EB5KHWmcly https://t.co/PjVIyPvD06

The ocean plays a critical role in our lives -- yet, it faces several threats.

The time to #SaveOurOcean is now.

Here are 5 reasons why we should all care about the planet's largest ecosystem: https://t.co/XyS4L6xAVF via @UNDESA https://t.co/OhZWPqFmWD

It is every child's right to be healthy, educated, safe & free from child labour.

On Sunday's #NoChildLabour Day, see what @FAO is doing to #EndChildLabour: https://t.co/5EUku4BWKl https://t.co/NlNAKtHxDk

Sea-level rise more than doubled over the last three decades.

We need global #ClimateAction NOW.

Get tips on how you can help protect our planet & our future: https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y https://t.co/CZE2HYBsnI

📚 Learning
🧸 Playing
🌟 Dreaming
This is how childhood should be spent. 

Yet, 160 million girls & boys are trapped in child labour.

More from @ilo on Sunday's #NoChildLabour Day: https://t.co/lfYwS1yky9 https://t.co/NhoVVaCf5T

Like all children, young people with disabilities have the universal right to learn. 

We must work together to build inclusive & accessible schools where every child is empowered, protected & respected. via @UNICEF https://t.co/iL78MPnjRb

Each of us can take action & say #NoToHate:

💠 Fact-check
💠 Challenge hate by sharing messages of tolerance
💠 Support people targeted by hate speech
💠 Report hate speech on social platforms

Share this & help make your social feeds a no hate zone! https://t.co/rSpMcD0VFL https://t.co/AAnQraedoV

What we share online can have consequences in the real world.

There is a lot of misinformation spreading right now, which can result in people being left uninformed & can put lives at risk during a crisis.

#PledgeToPause & verify facts before sharing. https://t.co/qFqoh7loX2 https://t.co/s9kZdz9y8h

Millions of women and children have fled Ukraine.

They have lost their homes, jobs, families & safety. 

They need peace now.

@UN_Women is working to help those affected by the war. 

You can help: https://t.co/mrMjJ1jRjC https://t.co/rWykMyXA0Z

⚡️ Save electricity & water. 💧
Reduce, re-use, recycle. ♻
Bike to work. 🚲

Small #ClimateAction steps can have a big impact. 

Share what you are doing to protect our planet by submitting a photo or video here: https://t.co/maSOl1pZzP #MyClimateAction via @Agora_awards https://t.co/yRvL451uab

"The war's impact on food security, energy & finance is systemic, severe & speeding up."

-- @antonioguterres says the war in Ukraine is having devastating impacts on the world's most vulnerable. https://t.co/sOzvgD7SX9 https://t.co/Qp9JQT9MZB

Although fewer people are attempting to cross the Mediterranean to reach Europe in search of a better future, the number of refugees & migrants losing their lives on such dangerous journeys has risen steeply. 

Latest update from @Refugees. ⬇️ https://t.co/MtmBj08ghs

1 in 3 women & girls experience violence in their lifetime.

@UN_Women says we can all learn to recognize the signs of an abusive relationship and help victims find safety and support. https://t.co/dmikJ2pbm5 https://t.co/bR48qQqojN

Collective action is the only path for ending the silent pandemic of gender-based violence worldwide.

-- @AminaJMohammed says men & women alike must join together to create safer societies for all. https://t.co/aqwe2F6Dfo

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love. 

We can all #StandUp4HumanRights and call out discrimination wherever we see it.

This #Pride month, stand up for the fair treatment of #LGBTIQ+ people everywhere. via @UN_Women https://t.co/vjJr82iQ0C

The war in Ukraine has caused one of the largest human displacement crises in the world.

Accurate & timely information is crucial for an effective response.

UNHCR's data portal has updated information on refugee registration & movements. via @Refugees https://t.co/iOHu7qFZdI

The Sahel is a region of opportunity. 

With more than 60% of its population under 25 year old, the region is posed to harness the hope & talents of young people to solve its most pressing challenges. 

More from @UNDP. ⬇️ https://t.co/DJGa2XSHXy

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis: 
Biking to work 🚴 
Switching off lights 💡
Reducing food waste 🚯 
& more.

Chat with us over @WhatsApp to get more tips on how you can #ActNow to take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/umJGSmhW7S

The world’s most vulnerable people are paying more money for less food. 

@FAO says record import costs are being driven by higher base prices & transport costs. https://t.co/mOVOwvh0rM

#UNGA has elected @EcuadorONU, @JapanMissionUN, @MaltaUNMission Mozambique & @swiss_un as non-permanent members of the Security Council for 2-year terms. https://t.co/2Q90QbwepA https://t.co/hamuRF9A2D

We're now on @WhatsApp! 

Chat with us over our new #ClimateAction messaging service and find out how you can #ActNow in your daily life to be part of the solution to the climate crisis. https://t.co/1e9CNwMRlX https://t.co/S2XiScTTRz

Greater ambition & urgency are needed to achieve the #GlobalGoals.

Billions of lives depend on it to secure a future of peace, dignity & prosperity.

See how the UN is working in countries around the world to fulfill the promise of the Goals. https://t.co/J9qYO6qMFy via @UN_SDG

Talking to your child about mental health can feel daunting, especially during the #COVID19 pandemic and other global challenges.  

@UNICEF has expert tips to get you started. #OnMyMind https://t.co/ggnGhJ3lHD

Plant a tree 🌳
Reduce your food waste 🍝
Save energy 💡

Share what you are doing to protect the planet by submitting a photo or video of your #ClimateAction here: https://t.co/maSOl18obf #MyClimateAction via 
@Agora_awards https://t.co/ebMzE0oBOG

Assistant Secretary-General for Safety & Security Unaisi Vuniwaqa has been #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping in dangerous places.

In the latest episode of Awake At Night, she shares how her deep sense of community has driven her career. https://t.co/TwQSYgC9dJ https://t.co/7J0ajvgOqE

"We must act now to save lives and livelihoods over the next months and years."

-- @antonioguterres warns that the impact of the war in Ukraine on food security, energy & finance is systemic, severe & speeding up, https://t.co/Jo2QA1rB9u https://t.co/NxJbUbEitb

Ukraine: To ensure food & aide can reach everyone, @WFP has partnered with @Uber - using their fleet of smaller vehicles to better dispatch items into city areas. 
https://t.co/fh1TpZLbnO

Across Ethiopia, Kenya & Somalia, more than 1.7 million children are in urgent need of treatment for severe acute malnutrition.

@UNICEF warns that without immediate action, the worst may be yet to come for the region's children. https://t.co/0vuJ1iUI4M https://t.co/hSVYyuNlhu

"It will take global action to fix this global crisis."

-- @antonioguterres says the Russian invasion of Ukraine must end, but until that happens, immediate action must be taken to bring stability to global food & energy markets & help the poorest. https://t.co/sOzvgD7SX9 https://t.co/GbBcXi76Lb

The science is clear: the ocean is seriously degraded. 

@UNDP shares 10 things you can do to #SaveOurOcean on Wednesday's #WorldOceansDay & every day: https://t.co/c2uHJCrjDE https://t.co/yeM3jC6kEs

Racism, xenophobia and intolerance are damaging to all societies. 

But, there are many ways YOU can take action and #FightRacism:

☝️ Call out racism and hate speech
💬 Start conversations
📣 Change the narrative

https://t.co/cCd3JjLrsV https://t.co/ASpAIhusa9

By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the ocean. 

We all have a role to play to #SaveOurOcean & our future. 

See how on Wednesday's #WorldOceansDay: https://t.co/QtPJbVXpcf https://t.co/v5xF8FCo53

"Working with civil society is an important element of the UN's work on the ground to achieve the #GlobalGoals."

-- @AminaJMohammed during visit to Central Asia. https://t.co/FtYtLYZY5R https://t.co/Z2vaTimJRI

The ocean is the greatest ally in our efforts to address the climate crisis, generating 50% of the oxygen we need & absorbing 25% of all carbon dioxide emissions.

Wednesday's #WorldOceansDay is a reminder of the urgency to #SaveOurOcean. https://t.co/wmZGFeZOZE

Join us in congratulating Téné Maïmouna Zoungrana of Burkina Faso on receiving the UN Trailblazer Award for Women Justice & Corrections Officers. 

Find out about her work #ServingForPeace with @UN_CAR: https://t.co/BqXgRXR0Gt

All of us can help #SaveOurOcean:
🍴 Avoid single-use plastics.
🏖️ Participate in beach clean-ups.
🐟 Only eat seafood from sustainable fisheries.
🗣️ Help spread the word!

More on Wednesday's #WorldOceanDay: https://t.co/wmZGFeZOZE https://t.co/dZMQOZeLYl

Csaba Kőrösi of Hungary has been elected @UN_PGA for the 77th #UNGA session starting in September. 

See his bio & learn more about his election here: https://t.co/n7l4B6EojN https://t.co/56VC258SPc

The climate crisis also affects food safety.

On Tuesday's #WorldFoodSafetyDay, see how rising temperatures threaten the production of safe food. https://t.co/bGG5SwXxSF via @FAO

 https://t.co/gxvnKdnjz4

Humanitarians protect the life & dignity of people caught in armed conflict around the world. 

They provide shelter, food, water, medical assistance & more to those in need.

They are #NotATarget.

More on their work: https://t.co/RvlpCWTmH7 via @UNOCHA  https://t.co/JtJuRxM0JR

Every year, 600 million people get sick after eating unsafe food & 420,000 die.

On Tuesday's #WorldFoodSafetyDay, @FAO explains how to avoid that: https://t.co/wpPsjIsnbk https://t.co/PsdzEL9TYo

Words can be weapons. 

Hate speech online can lead to cruelty & violence in real life. 

Get tips for how you can say #NoToHate: https://t.co/LiLrhbdSBr https://t.co/Vd6D9kOAaB

Food safety can:
☑️ prevent foodborne illnesses,
☑️ promote healthy diets & lifestyles,
☑️ reduce food loss & waste,
and more! 

Here are some food safety tips from @FAO on Tuesday's #WorldFoodSafetyDay: https://t.co/ZkvlZ8RaoC https://t.co/KvkCexQ0wh

Numerous crises threaten the hopes & futures of young people around the world. 

On Monday, #UNGA discussed how they can be empowered to play an active role in crime prevention policies to make communities safer for everyone. 
https://t.co/U2aQVnpEu5

Allegations of sexual violence by Russian troops in Ukraine are mounting, UN special representative for @endrapeinwar Pramila Patten, who recently visited the country, tells the Security Council. 
https://t.co/Ymvr1Cjd6X

Digital exclusion stunts economic development and deepens inequalities. Yet, connectivity is still a luxury for many people around the world.

Get details in the new @ITU Global Connectivity Report: https://t.co/cD3tuwzhfq https://t.co/xjqlLPttxc

Hate speech can take many different forms. 

But no matter what it looks like, hate speech has real consequences. 

Take action and say #NoToHate: https://t.co/7KugkNkHMJ https://t.co/cyVbD31zBi

Over-consumption in the world’s richest countries is creating unhealthy, dangerous and toxic conditions for children globally.

@UNICEF says policies & practices that safeguard the natural environment must be put into place to protect future generations. https://t.co/GuFsoz07sb

Monday is Russian Language Day.

Follow @UnitedNationsRU for updates on the UN's work in Russian. https://t.co/nfvhf0VWT0

"Oceans have a role in everyday life as the 'lungs of our planet' and as a source of food & medicine."

-- @antonioguterres on the urgent need to #SaveOurOcean to protect our future. 

More ahead of the UN Ocean Conference: https://t.co/k39IgotMy0 https://t.co/t01bhpNTB6

Coal & fossil fuels are killing our planet.

Don’t work for climate-wreckers. Use your talents to drive #ClimateAction. 

More ways you can #ActNow to protect our planet and our future: https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/X1ZFMuAD44

Unaisi Vuniwaqa grew up in Fiji, was #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping in South Sudan & now works as Assistant Secretary-General for Safety & Security. 

In our Awake At Night podcast, she explains how her deep sense of community has driven her career. https://t.co/TwQSYgC9dJ https://t.co/yHSr2dcNED

📢 Calling all photographers! 

The annual photo competition for the 2023 @WMO calendar is now open for entries.

Submit your photos capturing the beauty & power of our natural environment and showcasing why meteorology matters: https://t.co/WfEo8H1byd https://t.co/0Rna45BFYA
